item.title: By: Philippe Riand
item.dc:creator: Philippe Riand
item.description: <p>Have you tried the built-in localization capabilities of XPages?<br/><br />It should be simplier to use and will properly scale. It avoids any runtime lookup in a hashtable, and makes localized apps as fast as non localized one.<br/><br />Having a javascript expression per property value works, although it leads to a lot of formula evaluation, thus decreasing the overall performance. Moreover, it makes the WYSIWYG experience worse, as formulas appear all over the place.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Have you tried the built-in localization capabilities of XPages?

It should be simplier to use and will properly scale. It avoids any runtime lookup in a hashtable, and makes localized apps as fast as non localized one.

Having a javascript expression per property value works, although it leads to a lot of formula evaluation, thus decreasing the overall performance. Moreover, it makes the WYSIWYG experience worse, as formulas appear all over the place.

item.title: By: Patrick Kwinten
item.dc:creator: Patrick Kwinten
item.description: <p>yes give me as much as (good) (advanced) XPage sessions as possible. <br/><br /><br/><br />Let me forget this Domino nightmare that we have experienced the last 5 years as quickly as possible. <br/><br /><br/><br />Thanks in advance! <img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLS/$File/biggrin.gif"</a> /> </p>
item.content:encoded:
yes give me as much as (good) (advanced) XPage sessions as possible.

Let me forget this Domino nightmare that we have experienced the last 5 years as quickly as possible.

Thanks in advance! http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5MZVLS/$File/biggrin.gif“ />
